org.opensocial.client
Class OpenSocialOAuthClient

java.lang.Object
  org.opensocial.client.OpenSocialOAuthClient

public class OpenSocialOAuthClient
extends java.lang.Object

A utility object containing various static methods for dealing with OAuth in the context of OpenSocial. Included in these are static methods for digitally signing, verifying the signature of requests signed by OpenSocial containers, and retrieving access tokens from these containers.

Author:
Jason Cooper, Cassandra Doll

Method Detail

signRequest

public static void signRequest(OpenSocialHttpRequest request,
                               OpenSocialClient client)
                        throws OpenSocialRequestException,
                               java.io.IOException
Extracts pertinent properties from passed OpenSocialClient object and passes these along with OpenSocialHttpRequest object to a separate method which does the actual signing.

Parameters:
request - OpenSocialHttpRequest object which contains both the URL to sign as well as the POST body which must be included as a parameter when signing POST requests
client - OpenSocialClient object with various properties, both optional and required, used during the signing process
Throws:
OpenSocialRequestException
java.io.IOException

signRequest

public static void signRequest(OpenSocialHttpRequest request,
                               java.lang.String token,
                               java.lang.String viewerId,
                               java.lang.String consumerKey,
                               java.lang.String consumerSecret,
                               java.lang.String accessToken,
                               java.lang.String accessTokenSecret)
                        throws OpenSocialRequestException,
                               java.io.IOException
Adds optional query string parameters to request URL if present, then passes the passed OpenSocialHttpRequest to a separate method which does the actual signing.

Parameters:
request - OpenSocialHttpRequest object which contains both the URL to sign as well as the POST body which must be included as a parameter when signing POST requests
token - Security token which can be borrowed from a running gadget and appended to the URL as a query string parameter instead of signing the request. These types of tokens are typically short- lived and must be refreshed often, making signing much more practical.
viewerId - ID of the user currently using the application (or for whom the application is making requests on behalf of). The ID is appended to the URL as a query string parameter so it can be signed with the rest of the URL.
consumerKey - Application key assigned and used by containers to uniquely identify applications
consumerSecret - Secret key shared between application owner and container. Used to generate the signature which is attached to the request so containers can verify the authenticity of the requests made by the client application.
accessToken - Used in 3 legged OAuth. The user's access token.
accessTokenSecret - Used in 3 legged OAuth. The user's access token secret.
Throws:
OpenSocialRequestException
java.io.IOException

signRequest

public static void signRequest(OpenSocialHttpRequest request,
                               java.lang.String consumerKey,
                               java.lang.String consumerSecret,
                               java.lang.String accessToken,
                               java.lang.String accessTokenSecret)
                        throws OpenSocialRequestException,
                               java.io.IOException
Signs the URL associated with the passed request object using the passed consumer key and secret in accordance with the OAuth specification and appends signature and other required parameters to the URL as query string parameters.

Parameters:
request - OpenSocialHttpRequest object which contains both the URL to sign as well as the POST body which must be included as a parameter when signing POST requests
consumerKey - Application key assigned and used by containers to uniquely identify applications
consumerSecret - Secret key shared between application owner and container. Used to generate the signature which is attached to the request so containers can verify the authenticity of the requests made by the client application.
accessToken - Used in 3 legged OAuth. The user's access token.
accessTokenSecret - Used in 3 legged OAuth. The user's access token secret.
Throws:
OpenSocialRequestException
java.io.IOException

verifyHmacSignature

public static boolean verifyHmacSignature(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                          java.lang.String consumerSecret)
                                   throws java.io.IOException,
                                          java.net.URISyntaxException
Validates the passed request by reconstructing the original URL and parameters and generating a signature following the OAuth HMAC-SHA1 specification and using the passed secret key.

Parameters:
request - Servlet request containing required information for reconstructing the signature such as the request's URL components and parameters
consumerSecret - Secret key shared between application owner and container. Used by containers when issuing signed makeRequests and by client applications to verify the source of these requests and the authenticity of its parameters.
Returns:
true if the signature generated in this function matches the signature in the passed request, false otherwise
Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.net.URISyntaxException

                                         java.lang.String certificate)
                                  throws java.io.IOException,
                                         java.net.URISyntaxException
Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.net.URISyntaxException

Constructs and returns the full URL associated with the passed request object.

Parameters:
request - Servlet request object with methods for retrieving the various components of the request URL

getRequestParameters

public static java.util.List<net.oauth.OAuth.Parameter> getRequestParameters(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
Constructs and returns a List of OAuth.Parameter objects, one per parameter in the passed request.

Parameters:
request - Servlet request object with methods for retrieving the full set of parameters passed with the request
